alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 18 at 10:44PM MST until August 19 at 2:45AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Beaver Creek in southern Coconino County Arizona... and eastern Yavapai County Arizona... * Until 245 AM MST. * At 1030 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near and along Beaver Creek. Between 1.5 and 2.75 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.25 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. A stream gauge at Beaver Creek near Rimrock has shown the creek level rising nearly 4.5 feet with the creek rapidly rising nearly 3 feet in the past 30 minutes. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Rimrock near Beaver Creek, Montezuma Well, Lake Montezuma, Mcguireville near Beaver Creek, Montezuma Castle National Monument, V Bar V Visitors Center and Wet Beaver Creek Campground. This includes the following highways... Interstate 17 between mile markers 291 and 292. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Jacks Canyon, Brady Canyon, Long Canyon, Beaver Creek, Dry Beaver Creek, Russell Wash and Walker Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
